intro: Phyllanthus falcatus var. praelongus, commonly known as the longleaf phyllanthus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly Kenya and Tanzania, where it thrives in moist, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its elongated, falcate (sickle-shaped) leaves and small, clustered yellow flowers. It typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local flora and a subject of interest in botanical studies.
